subject: Re: New member
author: Guy
full_text:
Hi, Zack.

I have my BSEE from U of I in your neck of the woods! Yep...I've 
lived on campus in both Urbana and Champaign. It's been years since 
I've been back (actually - not since I graduated in 
1980...lol...THAT dates me!). I've studied on and off for both my 
commercial radio license and ham license but just never followed 
through on getting them - too many other things going on.

By the way - I was born and raised in Moline (the Quad Cities) but 
now I'm thoroughly "embedded" here in Southern California...no more 
ice and freezing cold and snow for me!

Have you downloaded and tried Stefan Bion's EVPMaker yet? As you 
know from reading Frank's documentation - that's what he based 
the "Ghost Box" on...

Anyhow - welcome!

Guy


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Zack Widup <w9sz@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> 
> I just joined and I thought I'd introduce myself.
> 
> I am an electrical engineer, radio amateur and a ghost hunter 
living in 
> Urbana, IL. (Well, I like the term "paranormal investigator" 
better!)
> 
> I've gotten a lot of EVP's on a pocket DVR but I found and 
downloaded the 
> schematics for Frank's ghost box some months ago.  I'm fascinated 
by this 
> idea and I hope I can find the time to build the equipmeont some 
time 
> soon. Hopefully I will get beyond the 70-80 hour work weeks I've 
been 
> putting in for the last couple months ...
> 
> Looking forward to seeing what's happening on this group!
> 
> Zack
>
